comments.body: I don't think there is support for multiple URLs. Are both of these needed or will one of them be sufficient? If both are needed, the build will need to download and decompress it manually.
Oh there is. All are tried in this order. So if the package at some point gets archived we have a fallback URL. In BioConda we include 3 URLs. The third one our own archive URL.

Weird. There was discussion about having multiple URLs that all got downloaded at once, but I don't recall whatever came of that (if anything?). Fallback URLs are a very different idea. Is that intentional by `conda-build` or does this just happen to work?
In any event, I would suggest picking one and seeing if that fixes the issue.

Only the first one is working today, but tomorrow only the second one can work.
This is what all 500+ r-* packages are using https://github.com/conda-forge/r-dplyr-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml#L12 and we never had a problem with it.
Ok. It's only a suggestion to try to solve the problem. Even if we do find it is needed at `staged-recipes`, it can be reverted in the feedstock.
How do we want to handle `license_file` here?

Our current policy has been to make sure that GPL licenses are properly shipped with conda-forge R binaries, but we do not currently do this for the other licenses because they are templates.

The discussion on how to ship licenses for R packages is in https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/3234

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +43,47 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/jeroen/rsvg#readme
  license: MIT
  summary: Renders vector-based svg images into high-quality custom-size bitmap arrays using
    'librsvg2'. The resulting bitmap can be written to e.g. png, jpeg or webp format.

comments.body: I think R 3.3. is not compatible with the current pinning of librsvg. `>=3.4.1` will help I think.

Unfortunately it looks like it isn't compatible with either R 3.3.2 or R 3.4.1:

```
$ conda build --R 3.4.1 recipes/r-rsvg/
BUILD START: r-rsvg-1.1-r3.4.1_0
    (actual version deferred until further download or env creation)
updating index in: /opt/conda/conda-bld/linux-64
updating index in: /opt/conda/conda-bld/noarch
Can't build /root/staged-recipes/recipes/r-rsvg due to unsatisfiable dependencies:
The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - librsvg
  - r-base 3.4.1*
Use "conda info <package>" to see the dependencies for each package.

$ conda build --R 3.3.2 recipes/r-rsvg/
BUILD START: r-rsvg-1.1-r3.3.2_0
    (actual version deferred until further download or env creation)
Can't build /root/staged-recipes/recipes/r-rsvg due to unsatisfiable dependencies:
The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - librsvg
  - r-base 3.3.2*
Use "conda info <package>" to see the dependencies for each package.
```
Just looking at the direct dependencies from `conda info` wasn't helpful. They both share `libxml2` and `pango`, but the pinning is the same. So it must be a downstream dependency that conflicts.

Yep, @bgruening I think you are right. The pinning for r-base needs to be updated. For example, `r-base` is pinned to `zlib 1.2.8`, which is incompatible with `librsvg`:

```
$ conda create -y -n zlib librsvg zlib==1.2.8
Fetching package metadata .............
Solving package specifications: .

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - librsvg -> glib 2.55.* -> zlib 1.2.11
  - zlib ==1.2.8
Use "conda info <package>" to see the dependencies for each package.
```

Wow! I would have needed much more time to pin that down so quickly! Thanks a lot!
I assume we put this on hold and trigger a rebuild when `r-base` is pinned to a more recent `zlib`?

> trigger a rebuild when r-base is pinned to a more recent zlib

@jenzopr Exactly! The pins for R 3.4.1 were just updated in https://github.com/conda-forge/r-base-feedstock/pull/27. So now you'll need to wait until the pins are updated for R 3.3.2.
Updated pins for R 3.3.2 are pending in https://github.com/conda-forge/r-base-feedstock/pull/28
PR merged, lets wait a few minutes and restart this one here :)
In the future, you can put this on one line with the selector `[win or osx]`.
